message:
or some namespace modification like that :
https://github.com/mitsuhiko/werkzeug/blob/master/werkzeug/__init__.py

Is wing able to detect the new python 3 syntax for functions ?

>>> def f(x: int) -> int: pass
>>> def open(filename: str, mode: str, buffering: int): pass
We don't yet detect Python 3 optional types but you can put "isinstance(value, typename)" in your code to give Wing hints about types.  We'll try to add detection of optional type syntax soon.

Note that running to a breakpoint in Wing's debugger gives you auto-completion/etc sourced from the live runtime state (both in the editor and Debug Probe).  That tends to be a pretty good way to write new code since you can immediately try things out in the Debug Probe and it covers more dynamic cases.
